website_summaries.verdict: A basic, no-frills soundbar that performs competently. The built-in subwoofers are decent, but not exceptional.
pros: Easy to mount on the wall
Built-in hardware improves sound quality from sources like smartphones
cons: Includes an output for an external subwoofer (sold separately)

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding Soundbar ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for Yamaha's new soundbar for a few months now...because Yamaha's have great reviews with the sound, however it's been a few years since they released a new one. and i'm glad I've waited! this soundbar sounds great!! no need for extra subwoofer for my small room. enough bass with built-in subwoofers! highs sound very clear!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES LEE

customer_reviews.title: This was one of the best investments I have made
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best investments I have made. Got this for mom so she could hear the TV. Flat screen speakers suck so I bought this sound bar for better sound. Not expecting alot but I tell you what hooked this up it sounds awesome. Sounds are way bigger than the speaker. Sounds like you have a separate bass hooked up. The sound is excellent. There is a voice setting that brings the voices out so you can hear but doesn't ruin the rest of the listening experience by putting to much voice and killing the rest of the background. Very good speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Kudos
customer_reviews.text: For the price given it is very decent option to upgrade TV speakers. DTS X Surround adds surprising clarity to sound. Make sure you tweek your TV sound settings to make output in Bitstream and DTS. It worked like a charm with my Samsung 55" 4K UHD TV. I bought Yamaha NS-SW100 sub to pair with this soundbar as it obviously lacks on low end despite built-in woofers. But they start from 60 Hz and power is low. Adding sub made this setup very decent sounding combo for total price paid. I can't compare with other soundbars, but from what I experienced in 2 weeks of using it, I don't need anything else. That is what my guts saying.
customer_reviews.author: Igoris C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bedroom sound system!  Surround actually works as well as the base settings
customer_reviews.text: You won't be unhappy with this purchase! We were skeptical about having no sub woofer. You don't need it with this set up. We matched this with a Sony 60" OLED. The voice enhancement feature is an added bonus! When enabling surround, we were testing it out with a movie and one of our cats about jumped out of his skin, as he was looking behind him for 'that sound', when it was actually being projected from 15 feet in front of him! Yep, surround works! Cat approved!f The fact that is is slim makes it easy to place.
customer_reviews.author: RedRebelChick

customer_reviews.title: 3 months of use and it quits
customer_reviews.text: I had originally gave this a 5 star but today in mid use, sound stops. I tried unplugging, nothing. Then redid all connections, nothing. I hope to call Yamaha Monday and try to exchange it. So weird I bought this in February 2018 from Amazon. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't BELIEVE what a great sound bar this is for the money
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't BELIEVE what a great sound bar this is for the money...just didn't have room for a SB/Subwoof combo so I made this stand alone my choice. Naturally you'll get better sound with a larger system but was surprised at the sound here: FULL tight bass & very clear mid/uppers. Has that good low bottom end with movies & sports...thought someone was at my door more than once! Amazingly complete input/out connections with just about anything you'll need; can't believe Yamaha makes other MORE EXPENSIVE units including a Sub with NO HDMI connections - I mean this is 2018!! Go figure?? Which is WHY I picked this one! Don't know how long it'll last but we'll see. 5/STARS
customer_reviews.author: G. Rogers Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware of the Size and Orientation When Wall Mounting
customer_reviews.text: Greatly improves the overall sound when watching TV, including sports and movies. There are plenty of acoustical adjustments depending on the media. The only issue I have with the product is the combination of overall size and the mounting hole placement (on the bottom). When hung, the sound bar now takes up 5+ inches of wall height below your TV. You'll notice all the pictures show this sound bar on a table top and not wall mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Apfels

customer_reviews.title: BOOMING Sound!
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a new LG 65" TV and the speakers were horrible (very tinny sounding with zero bass)... So that send me on a hunt for a sound bar... After wrestling between this one and the Bose soundbar... I chose this one because of the dual subwoofers built in... It sounds great! I'm very pleased with this purchase... and it fits perfectly between the legs of my TV. I don't thinking it would under a smaller TV, but it doesn't look awful so mounting it, or putting it in front of the TV probably not a horrible option. It's a middle of the line speaker with top of the line sound. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy & Edward

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar - would buy again
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar has very very good sound for the price. While it claims that it has subwoofers, I think that Yamaha stretch the definition of subwoofer a LOT. The sound bar by itself has deep rich sound and I really hemmed and hawed about adding a subwoofer or not. I finally did buy a, currently $90, and am glad I did. The separation it creates using the surround option is fantastic and the 'voice clarity' option does indeed help audibility of voices. It has a good remote that includes subwoofer volume. Bluetooth setup was easy and so far is reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Rich Expensive Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: rich sound. happy i went with Yamaha. easy set up when you know how. Amazon's Bruno had Yamaha contact me & within moments i had the audio i desired. had to go through a couple reps & extremely long hold time before Bruno. if you want nice sound & built-in bass (really enhances the experience & can be turned up, down or off - excell feature) Yamaha fulfills the bill without spending a huge amount. smaller cost produces smaller sound. very pleased & satisfied. no comparison between TV speaker & soundbar. this soundbar is the bomb!
customer_reviews.author: chazze

customer_reviews.title: Pair it with a subwoofer and you have a great setup
customer_reviews.text: I connected my MTX woofer to this and the sound is excellent. Make sure you install the DTSX update and that you connect everything properly. Ensure the DD or tge DTS light is on to get the full effect of the sound bar. I originally had it connected to an avr with pass-through enabled, but it was only receiving stereo and did not sound well. Connected directly it sounds great. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Will

customer_reviews.title: Ok sound, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as loud as I thought a soundbar would be. it is a relatively less expensive option so you can't expect fantastic sound I suppose. Just a little disappointed Not sure how much better it is then just using the sound on the TV at times. I even bought a high end HDMI chord to use with it hoping that would help. I also did the update that some people said made a huge difference. Still somewhat disappointing. If you crank it up then the sound is not bad but you can do that on the TV to.
customer_reviews.author: mreynolds

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up for very long...
customer_reviews.text: Ours broke within 3 months. The sound goes in and out. Trying to return it, if not insured, is a complete hassle. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Miss J

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that deserves 5 stars like all Yamaha products....but
customer_reviews.text: My older Vizio has 2 HDMI ports. This ad does not advise I need an ARC HDMI port, just repeats HDMI port. I thought,... I got that. I purchased several months ago, and just finally got around to installing it, so I am stuck with it. I never heard of an ARC HDMI. I am forced to use the Optical cable. Sounds poor. Suggestions? Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Best Soundbar for the Money, Hands Down!
customer_reviews.text: After getting a larger TV, I needed to upgrade My YAS-101 soundbar to one with a lower profile. I was always happy with the older model and was pleasantly surprised that the sound quality was even better with the the YAS-107! Better bass and better voice clarity and just an outright richer sound experience. The unit came with a 3' optical cable but I chose to take advantage of the ARC supported HDMI port instead. This allows me to control the unit with the TV remote or my Roku remote without any setup! The quality and value you get from this soundbar is unmatched.
customer_reviews.author: Thanos67

customer_reviews.title: Started static noise after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound. I like the clear voice option because im a subtitle junkie. Good bass. But after 6 months there was a continual static sound whenever there was noise coming from the speaker (both high and low tones - not just with the bass). I'm trying to get customer support, but Yamaha requires you to login before you can contact them. I dont need a Yamaha account.... just the manufacturer's warranty. If Yamaha fixes this, I would rate this with a 5 star review, and assume I simply recieved a fluke. It happens... I will edit this review to reflect the quality if the new speaker if I should receive one.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Had been wanting to upgrade my old sound bar for quite a while and decided to take a chance on this one primarily because of the built-in subwoofers and the ability to upgrade the firmware. A warehouse version of this bar does NOT have the ability to do firmware upgrades.We are extremely pleased with the sound quality and its features, particularly the ability to play music from our phones via Bluetooth. An external subwoofer can also be added; however, I doubt that we would ever do so because the sound quality with the built-in ones is perfectly fine for our needs. This has to be one of the best sound bars on the market in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: BobV

customer_reviews.title: Stops working in a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: The set up is not too difficult. However, it is not easy to figure out in what direction the sound bar should face. In order to face outward towards the listeners, you cannot see or easily access any of the buttons for volume or power. There is no way to tell if you are increasing the volume or by how much when you use the remote control until suddenly the sound is very loud. It stopped working after 5 weeks. I was able to reset it and get it working again but it happened again and again. Then nothing I tried could get this functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound... best bang-for-the-buck
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with the bar. I think even at full retail of $199 it would be the best bang-for-the-buck. I originally purchased a no-name soundbar for $110 and had to return it because it had a dent and because the sound was just not good enough. Mid-range was thin and no bass at all. For not having a sub-woofer, this little bar puts out an impressive amount of bass. The mid-range is full and highs are crisp. With the surround option on it really fills the space and makes watching classics like Star Wars fun again. Highly recommend this bar! If you can't get the 107, buy the 108, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jmnvhc

customer_reviews.title: Use HDMI !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first, i was very disappointed with this speaker. I used the 3.5mm (aux) connection with my projector in my "cinema"... DO NOT use that connection. It wasn't loud & had very little bass. I was just about to return when i tired the bluetooth. The sound was clear & bass was awesome!!! Long story short, i used the HDMI connections on my projector & the sound has been amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: Both myself, with severe hearing loss and the rest of the family whose hearing is fine, are very happy with the YAS-107, a we are presently using it without a separate woofer. The previous Samsung unit with a separate woofer doesn't even rate on the same scale. I find voices/dialog easier to understand and I don't need to drive family from the room running the volume up high enough. I can hear most dialog at their listening level, without hearing aids. We also found the Yamaha is on better speaking terms with other remotes (Samsung TV and FIOS service).
customer_reviews.author: K. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Picked one of these up after having lived with a YAS-207BL. Although this soundbar does provide a spacious and natural sound, it's not in the same league with the 207BL. The biggest difference is with the Atmos effects that this unit isn't capable of producing. Also, the clear voice and high/low frequency extension isn't comparable. I recommend opting for the 207BL if your budget allows.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Ew
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this is not a review about the quality of the product itself. I bought this "used." I expected to see a little wear here and there, I was okay with that. What I was not okay with was opening the box to a remote covered in a very sticky substance and looked as if it had been used as a throwing star at a wall. I was so grossed out I could not even continue to open the sound bar. I will be returning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sydni

customer_reviews.title: Could not get HDMI-ARC to work
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of the sound bar is excellent and the mid to high range sound is clear and voluminous. The bass is probably good for a sound bar, but coming from a 5+1 speaker system I missed the subwoofer. The remote is cheap and a let-down considering the price of the unit. I could not get HDMI-ARC to work. I don't know if it was a problem with the unit or my TV, but since ARC was the whole reason I bought a sound bar I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: The sound from the speaker is wonderful and very subtle
customer_reviews.text: The sound from the speaker is wonderful and very subtle. So often you hear speakers that accentuate specific sounds like treble or bass, but this one mixes all of the sounds together beautifully. You almost don’t realize the fidelity of the sound until you play something specific you’ve heard before, and then your like wow, I didn’t hear that instrument before. The speaker is also heavy and very well made. Well worth the price. The only downside is that the bar is huge. I have a 40” TV and it is longer than my TV. It’s also about 1.5 inches tall, sitting on my entertainment center.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: "When you want to change the volume...just click 3 times real quick and it wil catch up to the one level you want"
customer_reviews.text: So this thing sounds pretty great for the $$, and is a really good value. It even plugs HDMI directly into your TV's ARC port which allows you to control the volume with TV remote directly. Which is great, but also why the loss of one star. The volume lag when plugged into the ARC is pretty absurd... about your 4th-5th frustrated click it will catch up about 3 of them. Drove my kids nuts as the old one did not do that. But this one sounds better so I just tell them (and me) "When you want to change the volume...just click 3 times real quick and it will catch up to the one level you want"
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sound bar and a huge upgrade to the built-in speakers on my TV. Setup was simple and the sound is amazing. Great bass even though it doesn't have a separate sub-woofer. I have it connected to a Samsung TV via HDMI ARC so that my TV remote controls the sound bar. Although for some reason, the sound bar doesn't turn on when I turn on the TV. Connecting via Bluetooth to my devices was simple.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ames

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound bar
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about getting a sound bar to replace a mini system I have for the TV, because we got a JVC one for another TV and it did not sound that great. I don’t need full 5.1 or 7.1 surround, but I wanted better sound than the speakers on the TV gave (Samsung 50 inch JU7100). This sound bar gives good bass and very clear voices. I don’t even have to use the ClearVoice feature very much, and it does help out the vocal portion of the sound when enabled.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase. The Bluetooth worked immediately. For Netflix, it took me some time to figure out how to connect it, but I found the solution. I had to connect digital plugs, which I had at home, one red plug and one white plug to the audio outlets in the TV Set and the other end to the Yamaha, Then, the sound came from Netflix (or Sling, whatever other similar online TV service). The first movie we watched was "The LIfe of Pi", on a big screen. And, wow, the sound is very good! That Lion was roaring, and that storm was scary, haha, very well done, Yamaha!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Medina

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Bose Solo which I was using
customer_reviews.text: So many movies and series have low voice quality and this Bar really helps to enhance voice without taking away from the movie score or action sounds. Used with the TV's speakers, it really adds a unique sound experience. It's worth the $$ especially if one has a slight to moderate hearing loss as do I. Much better than the Bose Solo which I was using, but had to keep the volume so high to hear the voices, it distorted them.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Not a big fan of the bass because ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Not a big fan of the bass because it makes hearing conversations on the TV harder to hear. So I have it turned down all the way which works ok. The optical connector feels loose but maybe there all made that way because it works fine. Biggest drawback is that I have to use 2-remotes now. I hooked it up to the HDMI cable, which is suppose to eliminate the need for 2-remotes, but my TV didn't have an option to switch from the TV speakers to external speakers so it wouldn't work. So make sure your flat screen TV has that capability before buying.
customer_reviews.author: marknpeaches

customer_reviews.title: An amazingly great system!
customer_reviews.text: I was originally skeptical about a sound bar actually sounding good, but since I've bought many products from Yamaha in the past, and always liked them, I decided to go with this sound bar. The sound is amazingly good - the highs and bass all come through crisp and clear. And the bass is actually stunning considering the speaker size of the woofers. The power is very good and still sound clear at higher volumes. It works fine with a Blu-ray player, and I like its Bluetooth feature which I've used with my iPod.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: The sound is fine, a considerable improvement
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Yamaha 107BL to improve the sound from my Sony Bravia TV in part because, I understood from the Yamaha's specs, that it would mate with my Comcast cable remote. One remote. It worked sporadically, i.e. once every other time I turned the TV/speaker on. I sought technical help from Yamaha. No luck. I then suspected that I needed a newer TV, mine being 6 or 7 years old. I bought the current Sony model with high hopes. Same problem. The sound is fine, a considerable improvement. But I still need to use the Yamaha remote every other time I turn on the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Martin - Boston

customer_reviews.title: Misplaced operational status lights
customer_reviews.text: The operational status lights like On/Off, Volume, etc. are on the top of this unit, so when the unit is sitting under the T.V. and you're sitting in say a chair, you can't tell if the unit is on or off or what the other settings are. You have to get up and walk over to the unit to see the lights.
customer_reviews.author: shopperme

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have made this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This one is worth the cost for those budget shoppers out there. Standard volume can get very loud. Surround does a good job of expanding the sound and clarifying vocals. Stereo is as good as the signal coming in. Meaning that your provider must be doing their job and you equipment can handle it. I previously had a brand that could not handle changing from the cable provider to the TV to the DVD. This one, using only the optical connection, makes switching seamless. No loss of sound or switching from bar to TV sound.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sound for Price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price. I wanted to use the sound bar for television because my stereo pre-amp requires 8 tubes. Also, I wanted to see if I could get a clearer dialog. It certainly doesn't do music as well as my stereo system which new sold for really big bucks (I bought most of it used from a friend who had upgrade audiophile syndrome). However, you can hear dialogue better and I actually use the bar as a kind of center speaker sometimes when listening to CDs and especially SACDs.
customer_reviews.author: Electric Eclectic

customer_reviews.title: The ARC feature makes this easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The ARC feature makes the integration of this to an ARC compatible TV a seamless integration of the sound bar. I don't really need the remote OR to program it to any other remote, it just takes its volume cue directly from the TV or any other device on HDMI attached to the TV. The sound quality is good, but not spectacular. But then, I was replacing a full sized stereo with this device, so it isn't surprising the bar falls a little short. Certainly better sound than the TV by itself!
customer_reviews.author: dacash

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the money. I have a YAS-106 and love it. I was looking for another one when I saw this update had come out. I ordered it and could not he happier with it. It is a vast improvement over the tv's sound. And the price is great. I am probably going to order another one for another tv.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bibb

customer_reviews.title: Great for situations where you can't adequately do multi speaker sound but want nice TV sound with dimension & a bit of thunder
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! Works flawlessly with Samsung Anynet (CEC) and Harmony 650. The bass is really the equivalent of most any 6"-8" subwoofer. And the simulated surround is very well implemented.Excellent buy at $150. Mounted it with $15 dollar kit from Amazon over 50" Samsung curved LCD. Had to use a few bolts from the garage, but not too hard to do if you're handy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mars

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar definitely sounds better than my TV's built in speakers however, it doesn't sound quite as good as I was expecting. The low-end is more of a low/mid-range sound (not super deep bass) and seems to distort just a little bit at high volumes. The high-end does sound nice and crisp and the other options on the soundbar are excellent. This soundbar would be great if paired with a real subwoofer. Overall it seems you are getting more mid-high range sound with this soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Bunton

customer_reviews.title: wins over the BOSE sound bar and is a better price. Better value all around
customer_reviews.text: stunning. wins over the BOSE sound bar and is a better price. Better value all around. I also really like how quickly the bluetooth connects. It's basically instant and that has always been a pet peeve of mine.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Best soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this soundbar to replace the bulky 5.1 surround sound system in our living room due to needing extra space for our baby's toys. I could not be happier. This unit sounds amazing! The built in subwoofers add just enough bass to make the sound go from good to great. The sound, bluetooth ability and ease of setup are a 5/5. The 4/5 rating is simply because my DirecTV genie remote will not pair with it to control the volume (even though it says it's paired). I've tried and do own several other soundbar and this is the best one yet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Good but basic features.
customer_reviews.text: While I enjoy this sound bar I wish it had more control over the tone and other features like my Vizio 5.1 soundbar setup has. I find I have to turn the volume up very loud to be able to hear the voices clearly. The surround feature tends to muddle the voices where having it off leaves the sound lacking depth. This does do great for music however as this little thing can put out some bass for not having a sub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Clear Dialogue
customer_reviews.text: There isn't anything negative that I can say about this unit. You got to love Yamaha for quality products. The Soundbar has terrific Clarity and good deep bass at a loud enough volume for a decent size room. And if you don't think there's enough bass you can add a subwoofer to this unit just by plugging it in the back to a powered subwoofer to give you even more deep bass response. For the money I don't believe you can get a better sounding Soundbar I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Courtcop

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding and great price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sound bar. It was very easy to hookup and sounds really good. I will say that bass in it is fine but I do plan on buying a subwoofer to go with it because I do want a little more bass with my movies. My only gripe is the app is not working at all for me. I had read that they have had some problems with it on the new update, so hopefully they will get it fixed soon. I do kind of wish that it had WiFi too but it’s not a dealbreaker for me. Bottom line is it has a really good sound to it and at such a great price!
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for small rooms
customer_reviews.text: Works best in a small room. Had in a large room for the first 9 months and sound was just OK. Surround speakers far better. Then moved this soundbar to a small bedroom, and WOW- all of a sudden the sound "felt" like surround speakers. Final verdict? If this is a small bedroom, guest bedroom, etc. then the soundbar is great! However... If it's a large room, then it may disappoint for the amount of money it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Yinny99

customer_reviews.title: Excellent at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a sound bar that had a passive subwoofer out, because I had a powered subwoofer. For the price this is an excellent buy. Sound is loud and clear, and with the integrated subwoofer in the sound bar, there is a decent amount of punch already. As a standalone this has a simple yet decent amount of features to create the sound environment you are looking for. Pros: Low slim sexy profile Loud & Clear with Punch Price Cons: None that I have found
customer_reviews.author: Todd J. Kaminsky

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: WE had talked for some time about getting a soundbar for our 51" LG flat screen as sound from TV alone often muted and difficult to hear low sounds or conversations while watching movies. From stereo, surround sound, blue tooth functionality, embedded woofers for bass....this soundbar made all the difference in the world. Just need to get a few more speakers to work in concert with it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy F. Burneka

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound. Clean installation.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our bedroom TV. LOVE that it does not have a separate sub-woofer though one can be added. For our use, it doesn't need one. Gets plenty of bass as is with built-in subs. Works great and is controllable via the ARC input on the TV. We use it with an Apple TV4 and the apple remote turns it on, and controls volume. Tone settings still require the original remote but they are not changed much once things are set up. GREAT SOUND for the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: DHinFL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Soundbar for a Relatively Affordable price
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar is awesome. I purchased it after doing extensive research and comparing various soundbars features and overall reviews. I'm really glad I chose this particular model due to the amazing sound it puts out! One reviewer said it best: it should cost between four hundred and five hundred dollars, yet it sits at an easily attainable two hundred. There are a lot of choices out there, but if you want the best overall sound at a relatively affordable price, then this will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Sounds incredible! Sleek design!
customer_reviews.text: Love this sound bar and it was a great price! It fits perfectly in front of our 70" LG screen and sounds incredible! The ONLY area for improvement would be if the volume would display a range (i.e. 1-30) when turning up or down. Currently, it displays only a + or - on the screen. Sometimes, you want to be able to turn a show down before it starts to avoid blasting (Ahem, Netflix intro).
customer_reviews.author: Jillian J

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound bar for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the old sound bar that came with the television, this thing is like a night and day difference. Louder, clearer sound then what we were used to. Better base than what was available to us before. Expanded options, like bluetooth and a line to add a powered subwoofer. Am really happy with this sound bar, and the only downside is there are so many cords coming out of it now that I'll have to re-arrange how it is hung on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesphotog

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING SOUNDBAR. LOOK NO FURTHER.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast. I never would have imagined that a sou.d bar could replace my Bose and Polk speakers. I am still using a 400 watt powered Klipsch sub and it's a perfect combination with this Yamaha soundbar. I'm just amazed at how good it sounds. While watching movies it literally sounds like you have speakers to your left and right sides. Unreal.
customer_reviews.author: David Carter

customer_reviews.title: Sweet spot for sound quality vs. price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the in-laws and they absolutely love it! Excellent compromise choice between sound quality and price. Very easy to set up and the controls are fairly straight-forward. The remote is well-designed and the interface is clear. This is not a full home theater set up, of course, and won't match a set of separate speakers, but it does a surprisingly good job of mimicking a surround sound system. Very impressed with the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar is a well put together unit that is easy to use and set up.... If you are not into serious audiophile gear, this may fit your preference and budget exactly... It has some nice features, but listen to at least 5 sound bars in person to make the best decision....i only listened to two...
customer_reviews.author: James Caywood Knapp

customer_reviews.title: SOUND BAR HAS GREAT SOUND. OUR DEN IS 12X24 AND THIS SOUND ...
customer_reviews.text: SOUND BAR HAS GREAT SOUND. OUR DEN IS 12X24 AND THIS SOUND BAR FEELS IT WITH GREAT SOUNDS SPORTS EVENTS AND ACTION MOVIE JUST LIKE YOU ARE THERE LIVE. WE HAVE TRIED DIFFERENT SOUND BARS AND SURROUND SOUNDS, THIS ONE IS THE BEST. DOWNLOAD THE ADWARE, PLUG IT IN, SUPER BASS WITH CLEAR VOICE SOUND
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound w/plenty of bass  - couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: We downsized from a home with a large component surround-sound system. We wanted something that would provide quality sound output with a sense of surround - in a single, smaller package. The Yamaha fit the bill perfectly! We use Apple Airplay to stream music from our iTunes library (or other sources) to an Apple TV--and from there via optical audio to the Yamaha. Impressive results! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: BradB

customer_reviews.title: Surround sound doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Normal sound from the bar is ok. HDMI set up was fine. I am getting no surround effect at all. One post indicates you have to download a firmware update. On a new unit, doesn’t make sense. Anyway I tried, the instruction only say to look at the instructions supplied with the firmware. Is that something you have to buy in addition to the sound bar?
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound when paired with a 10" powered subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound when paired with a 10" powered subwoofer. Doesn't compare to the experience you'd get with a properly set up 5.1 speaker system, but the simplicity /convenience is a welcome trade-off. The soundbar does not always recognize the ARC sound signal resulting in the need to use the remote to choose the soundbar's HDMI input. If not for this last shortcoming, I would have rated this five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Burns

customer_reviews.title: This soundbar sounds great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar sounds great for the price, especially if you pair it with the Yamaha subwoofer. It puts out decent bass all by itself. But I find that the mid- and high-frequencies can sound muddy if you dial up the bass too much. By pairing it with the 8" subwoofer, the deep bass is off-loaded to the sub, which allows this soundbar to truly shine. Very happy with my purchase of this soundbar and the yamaha SW050BL sub!
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Total Sound
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this to my Samsung TV and the sound is superior with the built in subwoofer. However. Now that I’ve experienced what a subwoofer does I want to hook an excellent external subwoofer to this now. Would recommend this but if anyone knows an excellent subwoofer that I can connect please comment. Does it have to be the same brand or different?
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer √

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Soung quality is good. Certainly better than our expensive TV. Volume display leaves a bit more desired. No numeric display of current volume. Overall, happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: the dude

customer_reviews.title: Everyone with a smart tv should own this
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought a Samsung sound bar with wireless subwoofer to compensate my Samsung smart tv but I was super unhappy with the product. Then I started looking around and bought this Yamaha sound bar on amazon last Sunday and got it delivered on Tuesday afternoon. This one comes in the same price band but the sound output is so much good. I am more than happy with this specially with the 3D surround sound option. I am so much happy that I don’t think I would ever try changing Thai until it does :-)
customer_reviews.author: Delta-Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound quality without breaking the bank!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3rd sound bar I bought after returning the other 2. Finally found one I was happy with. Great subtle bass great overall sound. We don’t watch a lot of movies and aren’t big audiophiles. But I still want to tv to sound like the speaker isn’t a tin can. Hooked up in minutes. Only issue I had was with the new Samsung tv I bought it for. Had to dig deep into the settings to turn on my HDMI (arc) port.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I think this is a decent soundbar for the price. There are a lot of cool features, such as different modes of sound for gaming, movies, tv, and standard stereo output. It also has an app which can be downloaded to control the soundbar and to change different settings. This is useful because the remote that came with the sound bar sucks. It died within less than 2 months and replacing the battery didn't solve the problem. I'm not going to pay $30 minimum to buy a replacement remote that could easily go out as well, so I'm stuck having to turn on the system manually every time I want to use it. Oh well..
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: The sound from this is amazing! We got this because the sound on our TV is starting to crackle, but the picture is still perfect and I didn't want to buy a new TV. Now we don't know how we'd ever go back to watching TV without this! The clear voice function is awesome, and the built-in sub-woofer is perfect in our small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Stops working out of the blue
customer_reviews.text: this sound bar sucks. The first one stopped working after 6 weeks . Amazon sent me a new one . The second one stopped working after 11 weeks. Literally just stopped working while I was watching tv.
customer_reviews.author: Tkb

customer_reviews.title: Great for hearing announcers and tv show dialogue.
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could hear the announcers better on sports and so we do not have to turn up the volume too high on tv shows. This sound bar works very well for that purpose. It is easy plug and play with an HDMI cable. I LIKE the fact that there is no separate subwoofer, but if you want to add one you can.
customer_reviews.author: Deucestrutter

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy to install, economical
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of punch. Unless you have a giant room or are hard of hearing, you will not need a bigger sound bar or one with a separate subwoofer. Granted, our TV room isnt huge, but we still dont even get to 50% volume and it's more than loud enough. Pretty unobtrusive as well; we have it attached to the bottom of the TV with mounting straps. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound, and the clear voice feature has eliminated ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sound bar. I wanted a Sonos, but didn't want to pay the Sonos price! After reading reviews, we bought this one. We are completely blown away. Awesome sound, and the clear voice feature has eliminated our problem of not being able to tell what's being said! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, surround sound is excellent for games and videos
customer_reviews.text: This is the best speaker I’ve owned at this price point. The sound is rich and easy to tune to your needs. The surround sound is so good that I’ll occasionally swing my head around thinking that I heard something behind me. If you are an audiophile or want a good speaker to play competitive games were spatial sound is key, I’d highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Officer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth function is broke
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth feature of this device no longer works even though it’s sat well protected in one place in my home entertainment area. When the sound bar did function, the sound was satisfactory yet I’ve owned the product for a very short time and it’s now useless due to the Bluetooth connection feature no longer working regardless of what device I try to connect to.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T. Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you upgrade the FW, HUGE HUGE performancce ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you upgrade the FW, HUGE HUGE performancce difference. Noticed a slight sync issues in very specific situations - playing DVR shows, on network stations ONLY (NBC/ABC...). I have DirecTV so maybe it is a conflict with the service. However, live network programs, movies, Netflix, games and DVR shows on non-network channels work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: SO

customer_reviews.title: Terrible feedback after turning off TV
customer_reviews.text: I have this connected to my TCL 55" and about 10 minutes after turning off the TV, it emits a loud, high-pitched feedback like sound for about 30 seconds. I was asked to try plugging it into a different outlet than the TV, no luck. Hooked it up to another TV, does the same thing. Now tech support won't respond at all. Definitely go with a different option.
customer_reviews.author: MrsW2

customer_reviews.title: If this worked all the time, I could possible give more info
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work half the time, and the controls on the actual sound bar don't make any sense. It cuts in and out, and the cable that hooks to the tv doesn't fit in the socket securely. We bought this 2 days after we got a brand new smart tv and from about day 3 we've had issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deep rich sound
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sound bar. I did a lot of reading from the reviews to decide which one to get. The sound is amazing. I hooked up my cell phone in no time the TV took a little bit more but I’m a little bit challenged Tech wise Very happy with this purchase, then again I’ve only had it one day LOL I put on never enough from the greatest showman, watch the video on television turned out the lights and had this sound booming and I started to cry. Just beautiful
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen m.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked this up to a 55-inch TCL and it sounds great...with "bass extension" on, the bass is just right to my ear -- solid but not overpowering or boomy. Very simple setup and some nice features like the clear voice setting to highlight dialogue and a dimmer for the led lights. Hard to imagine a better single-unit soundbar at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: ScottT

customer_reviews.title: Great soundbar!
customer_reviews.text: Love this soundbar! Wanted a basic bump above a cheap soundbar without spending a lot of money or dealing with a dedicated sub. This fits the bill quite nicely. If you aren't expecting ridiculous amounts of bass from just a soundbar you will be pleasantly satisfied and Virtual DTS surround via a firmware update is icing on the cake. Using the ARC HDMI from my TV and everything works perfectly. Can also connect to my echo dot via bluetooth for bonus music. Would recommend to anyone looking for a non-sub reinforced soundbar...this ones a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: No, this isn't a full blown 7.1 surround sound system, but it is exactly what I was looking for. Much fuller sound. Even the built-in woofers are just about right. I also like that I have the option to add my own additional subwoofer if I want more. This is much better than the Samsung soundbar and subwoofer that I bought and returned.
customer_reviews.author: SJMaye

customer_reviews.title: I love this sound bar!
customer_reviews.text: When my audiophile boyfriend moved out and took his woofers and tweeters with him, I saw a good opportunity to downsize. Based on the reviews, I felt pretty confident in buying this sound bar and it did not disappoint. The sound is great. The Bluetooth capability is wonderful. The remote is small and easy. Now my tweeters are happy!
customer_reviews.author: mossum

customer_reviews.title: Great TV Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade from my TV Speakers. Connects Via Bluetooth Seamlessly, and its range goes around my entire house. Sounds great with out the need for a subwoofer. Only complaint is i havent quite figured out how to adjust volume from my tv remote.. Having 3 remotes now to keep track off TV/Cable, Fire Stick, no Speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: I have an 81 Yamaha motorcycle, excellent machine, the sound of this unit is amazing for the price just like the motorcycle 😎 Delivery was fast just a little confusing ! Price also, I'm Canadian & I'm not sure yet if I was charged in Canadian or American ? It's my first purchase on the American site so I guess I'll find out later ! Anyway I'm really enjoying this & the seller I can give a 10 out of 10. This is exactly what I was looking for at a lower price than I thought possible 😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really superior product
customer_reviews.text: Love this sound bar. Really great clarity, excellent remote response, built in woofers really add movie quality sound. I highly recommend this product. Easy to install, prompt delivery, cant go wrong with Yahama products. Surround sound excellent. Replaced a Mighty Rock sound bar which was garbage, do not purchase Mighty Rock.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Bennettt

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good for small rooms.  Easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted simple, easy, and high quality for a small bedroom and a small/medium sized living room. Setup is 1 minute. Easily switch from bluetooth to TV (just use inckuded optical cable). Perfect. Would not recommend for large rooms. Great product though. If you need giant bass then you should go for a system that has a seperate woofer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, and very easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second sound bar, but this one is much better than my first choice. From taking the product out of the box to hearing the sound from a television show, I would guess it took me less than ten minutes. Very straightforward, and if you use the optical connection you can run the sound from your regular remote.
customer_reviews.author: Zenbob

customer_reviews.title: I do like it. It has a decent amount of base
customer_reviews.text: First sound bar... I do like it. It has a decent amount of base, but I mostly got it so I could hear people speaking more clearly. This sound bar helps with that. It has plenty of options to tune it the way you prefer. My favorite part is being able to use and HDMI cable so I can use my TV or cable remote to control the volume Your tv must have the ability to do this also.
customer_reviews.author: GKF

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound, Confusing Interface
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, doesn't make voices that much clearer, but definitely an improvement over speakers in TV. Basic operation is simple enough, doing anything more complicated is confusing when you are working with tiny lights in various sequences on top of unit to tell you what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Schieftain

customer_reviews.title: Good soundbar for voice clarity
customer_reviews.text: We have cement floors and high wood ceilings, so there is not great acoustics. This soundbar helps voices to be heard over the music and for the audio to sound clearer than our previous soundbar. I also like the smaller size. It was easy to set up. My husband likes the woofers that some soundbars this size do not have.
customer_reviews.author: emily m.

customer_reviews.title: High quality sound bar for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: great sound bar for both tv and streaming music. i use this on my back patio with our outside big screen. sounds great in all modes. I use the YAS app for settings rather than the remote. Very nice quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: attymikeb

customer_reviews.title: The gold standard for price/performance in a soundbar
customer_reviews.text: I waited to purchase this when the YAS-108 came out so I could buy this at a discount. This is relatively the same soundbar as the YAS-108 at a clearance price. It sounds superior to internal TV speakers and is slim enough to be unintrusive. My only complaint is I could never get the Yamaha smartphone app to work with this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaffney

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sound and Value
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value. Great sound. Clear Voice mode and built in Subwoofers! Bluetooth ready as well. You can spend 3 times the money on Sonus. But is it really necessary?
customer_reviews.author: Gary DeVincenzo

customer_reviews.title: Hesitant at first, great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a person that buys most bang by the buck. I wasn't sure on buying this sound bar, but now that it is hooked up to my samsung t.v. it is pretty sweet. The bass is great, clear voice is great and the surround sound is good. I am super pleased with this sound bar! I will be buying another for my living room! Honestly, I am very surprised and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar definitely delivers. Before this I was just using my TVs sound, this is a night and day difference. The setup wasn't bad, would have preferred a quick start guide, but it was pretty simple. The bass is amazing for such a small setup, it gives the rumble similar to the theaters. Overall a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Doctoraven

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound - easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound - easy installation. Initially used optical audio but switch to HDMI so Samsung TV remote controls Amazon FireTV box and volume on Yamaha soundbar. Streamed music from iPad and laptop over bluetooth. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Omg the sound!
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great. I like the voice enhancer, and the souroumd sound feture. I got it for "The Big Game", but I love it just for watching tv LOL. It was easy to set up too. Mounting it was a little of a pain, but I got her sitting a foot above my tv.
customer_reviews.author: Stizan

customer_reviews.title: Wish there were more stars to add for this .
customer_reviews.text: This speak was so good we had to return the tv for a better one . The base with out a separate subwoofer is phenomenal!!!! Crystal clear amazing for the PlayStation and movies . Completely happy and more with this sound bar. Bye this with confidence you won’t be disappointed and I’m hard to please
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: I am using the HMDI-ARC cable from TV to soundbar and it works great. TV powers soundbar on and off and cable ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a reasonably priced soundbar. It is paired with an Insignia 50" TV. It took a bit of time to get the set up correct, I am using the HMDI-ARC cable from TV to soundbar and it works great. TV powers soundbar on and off and cable remote that previously controlled sound from TV now controls soundbar. As a warning for setup, you need to be patient, the soundbar powering takes about 20 seconds to follow TV, I was expecting immediate response causing me to think it wasn't working. Now it works great. Very good sound out of it. I may even eventually at the sub woofer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Good product not great volume.
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar is good quality I just wish the volume was a bit louder. It does not project sound as good as my other soundbar. That was a bit of a disappointment. It hooks up easily to my Samsung tv and changing the settings is easy. I would recommend it just know it won’t blow you away with volume.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Could be more practical.
customer_reviews.text: Very good. However, one cannot see what are doing pushing the remote control. It doesn’t appear on TV and doesn’t appear on the remote itself. So, many times you have to go to the bar sound to set.
customer_reviews.author: Joao A Kouyoumdjian

customer_reviews.title: Be warned:
customer_reviews.text: At higher yet reasonable volumes, the unit begins to rattle. Specific frequencies cause plastic parts to buzz and hum so irritatingly that you’ll want to smash it into pieces. Low volumes are ok and the sound is actually quite dynamic, but comparable to the TV’s own speakers. Complete waste of money in my opinion. I suggest you keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Henry
